TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit BulletedListDesigner extends System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner

Docs.summary: Used to provide design-time support in a visual designer for the Web server control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks In a visual designer, when you switch from Source to Design view, the markup source code that describes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> control is parsed and a design-time version of the control is created on the design surface. When you switch back to Source view, the design-time control is persisted to the markup source code and edited into the markup for the Web page.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The .NET Framework internally constructs a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BulletedListDesigner> class when it creates the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> control or a copy of that control on the design surface.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void PostFilterEvents(class System.Collections.IDictionary events) cil managed

Docs.param: The that contains the objects representing the events of the control. The keys in the are event names.
Docs.summary: Allows the designer to filter the set of events that the associated control will expose at design time.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Control designers use methods that are derived from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentDesigner.PostFilterEvents%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to filter the set of events that the control it is designing will expose through the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor> object.
For the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> control, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BulletedListDesigner.PostFilterEvents%2A> method removes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.SelectedIndexChanged> event from the list that is exposed by the designer.
The keys in the <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> interface are the names of the events. The values in the <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> are objects of type <xref:System.ComponentModel.EventDescriptor>.

block.para:
Overriding the method provides a way to change or remove items within the dictionary of events that are exposed by the designer for this control.
You can directly filter the dictionary that is accessible through the parameter, or you can leave it unchanged. If you are overriding the method, call the base implementation after you perform your own filtering.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the designer should use a temporary copy rather than the actual control that is associated with the designer to generate the design-time markup.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Because the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BulletedListDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> property is always `true`, the designer uses a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.View> control that contains a temporary copy of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> control to generate the design-time markup. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.View> control does not affect any persistence for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList>. If the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BulletedListDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> property were to return `false`, the designer would use the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> itself to generate the design-time markup.

block.para: You can override the property to return or to determine its value based on whether the control is marked with a class-level object. If the property is not overridden, the object ignores the .
